intro: Senecio sinforosii, commonly known as the Sinforosii groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Senecio sinforosii is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
